result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa A. Stever

records.addlTxt:
3:12 PM Defendant Melissa A. Stever appeared by video.  Attorney Ralph J Sczygelski appeared by video for Melissa A. Stever.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Inducement received.
Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:29 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Scheduling conference on November 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:40 pm - Defendant Melissa A. Stever appeared by video.  Attorney Ralph J Sczygelski appeared by video for Melissa A. Stever.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess Fentanyl and possess THC.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-22-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that she maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. 
Minutes.
